method.name: setoptions
method.shortdescription: Set the parameters of the search algorithm

param.name: threshold
param.description: a single channel threshold default is sqrt(3), which means together with 3 minimum channels at least 3 sigma detection criterion. For bad baseline shape, threshold may need to be increased.

param.name: minnchan
param.description: minimum number of channels above the threshold to report a detection, default is 3

param.name: avglimit
param.description: perform the averaging of no more than avglimit adjacent channels to search for broad lines Default is 8, but for a bad baseline shape this parameter should be decreased (may be even down to a minimum of 1 to disable this option) to avoid confusing of baseline undulations with a real line. Setting a very large value doesn't usually provide valid detections.

param.name: boxsize
param.description: the box size for running mean calculation. Default is 1./5. of the whole spectrum size

method.name: setscan
method.shortdescription: Set the 'scantable' data to work with, associated mask (mask parameter) and the edge channel rejection (edge parameter)

param.name: mask
param.description: an optional mask retreived from sdtable

param.name: edge
param.description: an optional number of channel to drop. If edge has zero length, all channels chosen by mask will be used. If edge has one element only, it represents the number of channels to drop from both sides of the spectrum. edge is introduced for convinience, although all functionality can be achieved using a spectrum mask only

method.name: findlines
method.shortdescription: search for spectral lines for a row specified by whichRow and Beam/IF/Pol specified by current cursor set for the scantable. Number of lines found is returned.

method.name: getmask
method.shortdescription: get the mask to mask out all lines that have been found (default)

param.name: invert
param.description: If invert=true, only channels belong to lines will be unmasked. Note: all channels originally masked by the input mask (mask in setscan) or dropped out by the edge parameter (edge in setscan) are still excluded regardless on the invert option.

method.name: getlineranges
method.shortdescription: Get range for all lines found. The same units as used in the scan will be returned (e.g. velocity instead of channels).

method.name: getlinerangesinchannels
method.shortdescription: The same as getLineRanges, but channels are always used to specify the range.
